trek.title: Gorilla Trekking
trek.description: Gorilla trekking in Rwanda is a unique experience that will allow you to observe these magnificent primates in their natural habitat. Accompanied by an experienced guide, you will venture into the dense forest of Volcanoes National Park to observe a family of mountain gorillas. This activity directly contributes to the conservation of this endangered species and to the development of local communities.

geography.title: Geography
geography.description: Located in East Africa, Rwanda is known as the "Land of a Thousand Hills" due to its mountainous landscape. With an area of 26,338 kmÂ², it shares its borders with Uganda to the north, Tanzania to the east, Burundi to the south, and the Democratic Republic of Congo to the west.

culture.title: Culture and Traditions
culture.description: Rwandan culture is rich and diverse, with traditions that date back several centuries. The traditional "Intore" dance is one of the country's most iconic cultural expressions, characterized by energetic movements and colorful costumes.

language.title: Language
language.description: Kinyarwanda is the national language of Rwanda, spoken by almost the entire population. French and English are also official languages, with English increasingly used in education and business.

gorillas.title: Mountain Gorillas
gorillas.description: Rwanda is home to about one-third of the world's population of mountain gorillas, an endangered species.

ecology.title: Ecology
ecology.description: Rwanda is one of the cleanest countries in Africa and has banned plastic bags since 2008.

women.title: Women in Power
women.description: Rwanda has one of the highest rates of women in parliament in the world, with over 60% representation.

coffee.title: Coffee and Tea
coffee.description: Rwandan coffee and tea are recognized worldwide for their exceptional quality and are important exports.

visit.title: Why Visit Rwanda?
visit.description1: Rwanda offers a unique travel experience combining extraordinary wildlife, spectacular landscapes, and a welcoming culture. From gorilla trekking in Volcanoes National Park to safaris in Akagera National Park, to the serene beauty of Lake Kivu, Rwanda is a destination that leaves a lasting impression.
visit.description2: Additionally, the country is known for its safety, cleanliness, and rapidly developing infrastructure, making it an increasingly popular destination for travelers from around the world.
